A gp locum can be a very fulfilling career and even a curse, based on the way you look at it. There are some gps who wanted to switch careers, after a few months of being a gp locum. However there are many ;http://www.nexopia.com/users/oliverbulloc622/blog/1-advantages-and-disadvantages-of-being-a-gp-locum;]gp locums[/url] who love this profession and look forward to another satisfying day of work.
;
;The reality is that it depends on the aptitude of a person and how well he/she is able to adjust to this career.
;
;If you are a gp locum, then here are a few hurdles you could face in your profession:
;
;1. You donâ€™t have a fixed consulting room and you have to adjust to the one you have as soon as possible otherwise there is a danger of being criticised even though the fault may not be entirely yours.
;
;2. Sometimes, there are no machines at all and the gp has to bring his own. Imagine how stressful it can be when you are about to examine someone and the equipment doesnt work due to low or no batteries at all. Under these circumstances, all you can do is to talk to the gp partners and make sure they know the difficulties you are facing and the steps they ought to take to help you out.
;
;3. You have to walk into an unknown practice to see unknown patients. You dont know their health background because the documents are missing and you have no clue how/where to find them. For someone who is new to this profession, this situation could be an absolute nightmare.
;
;Now, I am not saying that all ;locum gps; have to work in these types of situations. Now, this doesnt mean that whatever practice you join is going to be like this. I just want you to take note of the down sides a gp locum has to face one or more times in his profession.
;
;But being a gp locum is not about facing difficulties and to be able to get used to difficult situations. There are numerous things to like about being a locum gp and I have listed some of these here:
;
;1. You will have the freedom to walk away from a practice if you dont like the way they work. Actually, I even know a few locum gps who decided to leave the practice because the gp partners didnt care about the patients at all.
;
;2. In locum work you choose the exact kind of life you want to live. You could work as a gp 3 or 4 days a week and play golf for the rest of the week. Or maybe you could work as a gp for six months and go for a world tour the rest of the year. You get to choose.
;
;3. Different practices have different procedures of working - They have different machines, different softwares and different ways of recording consultations. This way you get to learn a lot more and become more useful as a gp locum.
;
;Being a gp locum need not be a stressful thing. You can have a very successful and enjoyable career as a gp locum.
